Solidarity Meeting Held in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Solidarity Meeting Held in Bangladesh 
    Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- A meeting supporting the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo (DFRK) was held in Dhaka on Oct. 20 under the co-sponsorship of the Left Democratic Front of Bangladesh and the Bangladesh-Korea Friendship Association.
 Speakers including Kamal Hyder, general secretary of the Bangladesh Peace Council, said at the meeting that 25 years ago from now President Kim Il Sung, on the basis of a scientific insight into the political situation at home and abroad, set forth the proposal for founding the DFRK, a proposal making it possible to achieve Korea's reunification most reasonably.
 The proposal is an offer for reunification fundamentally different from the proposals made by some other countries in the last period and reflects the will of all Koreans in the north and the south to achieve the reunification of Korea in the idea of "By our nation itself," they noted, adding that the world peace-loving people positively support the proposal as the most realistic and just one.    
 They stressed that the Bangladeshi progressives would invariably support the Korean people in their just cause to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea according to the proposal.    
 A joint statement adopted at the meeting denounced the reckless moves of the U.S. imperialists and the forces subservient to them to block the reunification of the Korean Peninsula and strongly demanded the U.S. dismantle its military bases for aggression in south Korea at once.
 At the end of the meeting its participants watched Korean film "The Concrete Wall, Symbol of National Division."

articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a gift from Youssef Amin Wali, vice-chairman of the National Democratic Party of Egypt, on the occasion of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 It was conveyed to the DPRK ambassador e. p. to Egypt by the vice-chairman.

articles.title: Secretary of Libyan People's Bureau Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Secretary of Libyan People's Bureau Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah, secretary of the People's Bureau of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya to the DPRK, Wednesday hosted a reception on the occasion of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 Present on invitation were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Rim Kyong Man, Minister of Foreign Trade, Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea, Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, and others.
 On hand were members of the People's Bureau.    
 Secretary Bashir Ramadan Khalifa Abu Janah said in a speech that the friendly relations between Libya and the DPRK have a deep historical root, adding that the friendly relations are now growing stronger under the deep concern of Colonel Moammer el Gaddafi and leader Kim Jong Il.
 Choe Thae Bok said in a speech that the Korean and Libyan peoples have dynamically struggled for a long time to build a new society against imperialism.
 We, he said, will make efforts to develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries in the idea of independence, peace and friendship in the future, too.    
 He wished the Libyan people greater successes in their struggle for the building of a free and prosperous new society and unity against the interference of the foreign forces under the leadership of Moammer el Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution.

Dong-A Ilbo Urged to Stop False Propaganda
articles.content:
Dong-A Ilbo Urged to Stop False Propaganda 
    Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification (Pomchonghakryon) issued a statement on Oct. 20 in which it termed Dong-A Ilbo a pro-Japanese and pro-U.S. reptile paper and demanded the disorganization of this conservative group.
 Accusing the newspaper of kicking up a row to slander the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification (Pomminryon) and Pomchonghakryon, legitimate bodies, after releasing misinformation that Pomminryon is the Workers' Party of Korea's vanguard organization in charge of south Korean affairs, the statement said: As far as these organizations are concerned, they have headquarters in the south, the north and overseas and strive for the great national unity and they are pro-reunification and patriotic movement organizations whose ultimate goals are to implement the June 15 joint declaration.    
 The statement urged the paper to face up to the trend of the times toward independent and peaceful reunification in the June 15 era, the spirit of the times, and stop its venomous rhetoric.

Foreigners Express Impressions of Korea
articles.content:
Foreigners Express Impressions of Korea
    Pyongyang, October 27 (KCNA) -- Foreigners participating in the First Pyongyang Autumn International Commodity Fair expressed their impressions of Korea. 
 Kang Weifeng, head of a delegation of the China National Electronic Materials Corp, said that he is convinced of rosy future of Korea which will display its might as a prosperous powerful nation.    
 Wang Tianyi, head of a delegation of the Atlas Copco Corp of Sweden, said: The Pyongyang International Commodity Fair will be of a good opportunity to deepening friendly and cooperative relations among countries and peoples in conformity with the desire and demand of humankind and propelling common progress and prosperity. During my visit I have realized that Korea is a politically very stable country. I was deeply moved to see the Korean people industriously working to create better living environments.
